question: A 39-year-old man presents to the emergency department because of progressively worsening chest pain and nausea that started at a local bar 30 minutes prior. The pain radiates to the epigastric area. He has a 5-year history of untreated hypertension. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 5 years and started abusing cocaine 2 weeks before his emergency room visit. The patient is diaphoretic and in marked distress. What should be the first step in management?
question_persian: مردی ۳۹ ساله به دلیل درد قفسه سینه و حالت تهوع که به صورت تدریجی بدتر شده و ۳۰ دقیقه قبل در یک بار محلی شروع شده بود، به بخش اورژانس مراجعه می‌کند. درد به ناحیه اپیگاستریک منتشر می‌شود. او سابقه ۵ ساله فشار خون بالا که درمان نشده است، دارد. او به مدت ۵ سال روزانه یک بسته سیگار کشیده و دو هفته قبل از مراجعه به اورژانس شروع به سوء استفاده از کوکائین کرده است. بیمار عرق کرده و در حالت اضطراب شدید است. اولین قدم در مدیریت درمانی چه باید باشد؟
new_question_stem: A 39-year-old man presents to the emergency department because of progressively worsening chest pain and nausea that started at a local bar 30 minutes prior. The pain radiates to the epigastric area. He has a 5-year history of untreated hypertension. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 5 years and has been using cocaine since 2 weeks ago. The patient is diaphoretic and in marked distress. What should be the first step in management?
additional_correct_answer_source: Rachel S. Wightman, Cocaine and Amphetamines, Tintinalli JE, Stapczynski JD, Ma OR, Cline DM, Riviello EA, editors. Tintinalli's Emergency Medicine 9th edition, New York, MCGraw-Hill-2021 p:1241

question: A 46-year-old man is brought to the emergency department for evaluation of altered mental status. He was found on the floor in front of his apartment. He is somnolent but responsive when aroused. His pulse is 64/min, respiratory rate is 15/min, and blood pressure is 120/75 mm Hg. On physical examination, an alcoholic smell and slurred speech are noted. Neurological exam shows diminished deep tendon reflexes bilaterally and an ataxic gait. His pupils are normal. Blood alcohol concentration is 0.04%. An ECG shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
question_persian: مردی ۴۶ ساله برای ارزیابی وضعیت تغییر یافته ذهنی به بخش اورژانس آورده شده است. او در جلوی آپارتمانش روی زمین پیدا شده است. او خواب‌آلود است اما وقتی بیدار می‌شود پاسخگو است. نبض او ۶۴ ضربه در دقیقه، تعداد تنفس ۱۵ بار در دقیقه و فشار خون ۱۲۰/۷۵ میلی‌متر جیوه است. در معاینه فیزیکی، بوی الکل و گفتار نامفهوم مشاهده می‌شود. معاینه عصبی نشان دهنده کاهش رفلکس‌های عمقی تاندونی به صورت دو طرفه و راه رفتن آتاکسیک است. مردمک‌های او طبیعی هستند. غلظت الکل خون او ۰.۰۴٪ است. نوار قلب (ECG) هیچ گونه ناهنجاری نشان نمی‌دهد. کدام یک از موارد زیر محتمل‌ترین علت علائم این بیمار است؟
new_question_stem: A 46-year-old man is brought to the emergency department for evaluation of altered mental status. He was found on the floor in front of his apartment. He is somnolent but responsive when aroused. His pulse rate is 64/min, respiratory rate is 15/min, and blood pressure is 120/75 mm Hg. On physical examination, an alcoholic smell and slurred speech are noted. Neurological exam shows diminished deep tendon reflexes bilaterally and an ataxic gait. His pupils are normal. Blood alcohol concentration is 0.04%. An ECG does not show any abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
additional_correct_answer:
Ethanol toxicity,
Estimation of alcohol levels is unreliable, particularly around levels of 100mg/dl or in alcohol-tolerant patients.
additional_correct_answer_source: Jennifer P. Cohen, Alcohols, Tintinalli JE, Stapczynski JD, Ma OR, Cline DM, Riviello EA, editors. Tintinalli's Emergency Medicine 9th edition, New York, MCGraw-Hill-2021 p:1223

question: A man is brought into the emergency department by the police department. The officer state that the man has been arrested multiple times for public alcohol intoxication, but recently became homeless. On exam, the man is behaving erratically. His vitals are all within normal limits. He appears confused and has a slurred speech. On gait exam, the patient is ataxic and cannot stand without support for more than a few seconds. Labs return with the following values: Na 140, K 4, Cl 106, BUN 8, Cr 2. His ABG has pH 7.3, PaCO2 13mm, PaO2 130mm, HCO3 7. His urinalysis is shown in Figure 1. Blood salicylate levels return as normal. While you await other diagnostic tests, which of the following should be administered next to treat this patient?
question_persian: مردی توسط پلیس به بخش اورژانس منتقل شده است. افسر پلیس بیان می‌کند که این مرد به دلیل مستی در اماکن عمومی چندین بار دستگیر شده است، اما اخیراً بی‌خانمان شده است. در معاینه، مرد رفتار ناپایداری دارد. علائم حیاتی او همگی در محدوده طبیعی هستند. او به نظر می‌رسد گیج باشد و گفتارش نامفهوم است. در معاینه راه رفتن، بیمار آتاکسیک است و نمی‌تواند بدون حمایت بیش از چند ثانیه بایستد. نتایج آزمایشگاه به صورت زیر است: Na 140، K 4، Cl 106، BUN 8، Cr 2. بررسی ABG او نشان می‌دهد که pH 7.3، PaCO2 13mm، PaO2 130mm، HCO3 7 است. آنالیز ادرار او در شکل ۱ نشان داده شده است. سطح سالیسیلات خون او نرمال است. در حالی که منتظر نتایج سایر آزمایشات تشخیصی هستید، کدام یک از موارد زیر باید برای درمان این بیمار بعدی تجویز شود؟
new_question_stem: A man is brought into the emergency department by the police department. The officer states that the man has been arrested multiple times for public alcohol intoxication, but recently became homeless. On physical examination, he is behaving erratically. His vitals are all within normal limits. He appears confused and has a slurred speech. The patient's gate is ataxic and cannot stand without support for more than a few seconds. Labs return with the following values: Na 140, K 4, Cl 106, BUN 8, Cr 2. His ABG has pH 7.3, PaCO2 13mm, PaO2 130mm, HCO3 7. His urinalysis is shown in Figure 1. Blood salicylate level is normal. While you await other diagnostic tests, which of the following should be administered next to treat this patient?
additional_correct_answer:
Ethanol, 
If fomepizole is not available or contraindicated, ethanol may be used.
additional_correct_answer_source: Jennifer P. Cohen, Alcohols, Tintinalli JE, Stapczynski JD, Ma OR, Cline DM, Riviello EA, editors. Tintinalli's Emergency Medicine 9th edition, New York, MCGraw-Hill-2021 p:1231

question: A 27-year-old man presents to the emergency department after a motor vehicle collision. The patient was the front seat unrestrained driver in a head on collision. The patient’s echocardiogram (ECG) is notable only for sinus tachycardia. His temperature is 99.5°F (37.5°C), blood pressure is 107/58 mmHg, pulse is 120/min, respirations are 17/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. The patient is given 2 liters of Ringer lactate solution and morphine. Initial workup demonstrates that the patient’s pulmonary capillary wedge pressure and troponins are elevated. The patient is currently complaining of chest pain. Physical exam is notable for an uncomfortable young man with bruising over his chest wall. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
question_persian: مردی ۲۷ ساله پس از تصادف خودرو به بخش اورژانس مراجعه می‌کند. بیمار راننده‌ بوده و کمربند ایمنی نبسته  بوده  است و دچار سانحه  تصادف شاخ به شاخ  شده است. نوار قلب (ECG) بیمار تاکی کاردی سینوسی را نشان می‌دهد. دمای بدن او 99.5 درجه فارنهایت (37.5 درجه سانتیگراد)، فشار خون 107/58 میلی‌متر جیوه، نبض 120 در دقیقه، تعداد تنفس 17 در دقیقه و اشباع اکسیژن 98٪ در هوای اتاق است. به بیمار ۲ لیتر محلول رینگر لاکتات و مورفین داده می‌شود. بررسی اولیه نشان می‌دهد که فشار گوه‌ای مویرگی ریوی و تروپونین‌های بیمار افزایش یافته است. بیمار در حال حاضر از درد قفسه سینه شکایت دارد. معاینه فیزیکی نشانگر یک جوان ناراحت با کبودی در ناحیه دیواره قفسه سینه است. کدام یک از تشخیص‌های زیر محتمل‌ترین است؟
new_question_stem: A 27-year-old man presents to the emergency department after a motor vehicle collision. The patient was the front seat unrestrained driver in a head on collision. The patient’s echocardiogram (ECG) is notable only for sinus tachycardia. His temperature is 99.5°F (37.5°C), blood pressure is 107/58 mmHg, pulse rate is 120/min, respiratory rate is 17/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. The patient is given 2 liters of Ringer lactate solution and morphine sulfate. Initial workup demonstrates that the patient’s pulmonary capillary wedge pressure and troponins are elevated. The patient is currently complaining of chest pain. Physical exam is notable for an uncomfortable young man with bruising over his chest wall. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

question: A 26-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department 20 minutes after being involved in a high-speed motor vehicle collision in which she was a restrained passenger. On arrival, she is lethargic and incoherent. She has severe facial lacerations and is in respiratory distress. Her pulse is 130/min, respirations are 29/min, and blood pressure is 90/58 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 70%. Examination shows multiple facial lacerations. There is dullness to percussion and decreased breath sounds over the left lung base. Abdominal examination shows diffuse tenderness with no guarding or rebound. Bowel sounds are normal. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities. Her hemoglobin concentration is 12.1 g/dL. An x-ray of the chest shows a fractured left second rib, depression of the left mainstem bronchus, deviation of the nasogastric tube to the right, and a widened mediastinum. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
question_persian: یک زن ۲۶ ساله ۲۰سرنشین جلوی خودرو  دقیقه پس از تصادف با خودروی با سرعت بالا  به اورژانس اورده می شود،او کمربند ایمنی بسته بوده. در زمان ورود، خواب‌آلود بوده و تکلم وی نامربوط  است. او دارای بریدگی‌های شدید صورت  تنگی نفس است. نبض او ۱۳۰ ضربه در دقیقه، تنفس ۲۹ بار در دقیقه، و فشار خون ۹۰/۵۸ میلی‌متر جیوه است. پالس اکسیمتری در هوای اتاق اشباع اکسیژن ۷۰٪ را نشان می‌دهد. معاینه نشان می‌دهد که او دارای بریدگی‌های متعدد صورت است. در قاعده ریه چپ،  صداهای تنفسی کاهش یافته است و دق ان مات می باشد. درمعاینه شکم  تندرنس منتشر بدون گاردینگ و ریباند تندرنس مشاهده می شود و صداهای روده نرمال هستند. بقیه معاینات نیز نرمال است. غلظت هموگلوبین او ۱۲.۱ گرم در دسی‌لیتر است. عکس رادیوگرافی قفسه سینه نشان می‌دهد که دنده دوم چپ شکسته، برونکوس اصلی چپ دپرس می باشد، لوله نازوگاستریک به سمت راست منحرف شده و مدیاستینوم وسیع شده است. محتمل‌ترین تشخیص کدام است؟
new_question_stem: A 26-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department 20 minutes after being involved in a high-speed motor vehicle collision in which she was a restrained passenger. On arrival, she is lethargic and incoherent. She has severe facial lacerations and is in respiratory distress. Her pulse is 130/min, respirations are 29/min, and blood pressure is 90/58 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 70%. Examination shows multiple facial lacerations. There is dullness to percussion and decreased breath sounds over the left lung base. Abdominal examination shows diffuse tenderness with no guarding or rebound. Bowel sounds are normal. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities. Her hemoglobin concentration is 12.1 g/dL. The chest x-ray shows a fractured left second rib, depression of the left mainstem bronchus, deviation of the nasogastric tube to the right, and a widened mediastinum. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

question: A 24-year-old man is brought to the emergency department 15 minutes after he sustained a stab wound to the left chest just below the clavicle. On arrival, he has rapid, shallow breathing and appears anxious. His pulse is 135/min, respirations are 30/min and shallow, and palpable systolic blood pressure is 80 mm Hg. He is intubated and mechanically ventilated. Infusion of 0.9% saline is begun. Five minutes later, his pulse is 133/min and blood pressure is 82/45 mm Hg. Examination shows no active external bleeding. There is a 2.5-cm single stab wound to the left chest at the 4th intercostal space at the midclavicular line. Cardiovascular examination shows muffled heart sounds and jugular venous distention. Breath sounds are normal. Further evaluation of this patient is most likely to show which of the following findings?
question_persian: یک مرد ۲۴ ساله ۱۵ دقیقه پس از اینکه دچار زخم چاقو به قفسه سینه در زیر استخوان ترقوه چپ شد، به بخش اورژانس آورده شده است. در بدو ورود، او دارای تنفس سریع و سطحی است و مضطرب به نظر می‌رسد. نبض او ۱۳۵ در دقیقه، تنفس ۳۰ در دقیقه و سطحی، و فشار خون سیستولیک قابل لمس ۸۰ میلی‌متر جیوه است. او لوله‌گذاری و به صورت مکانیکی تهویه می‌شود. تزریق محلول نمکی ۰.۹٪ آغاز می‌شود. پنج دقیقه بعد، نبض او ۱۳۳ در دقیقه و فشار خون ۸۲/۴۵ میلی‌متر جیوه است. معاینه نشان می‌دهد که خونریزی خارجی فعال ندارد. یک زخم چاقوی ۲.۵ سانتی‌متری در قفسه سینه چپ در فضای بین دنده‌ای چهارم در ناحیه  میدکلاویکل وجود دارد. معاینه قلبی عروقی صداهای قلبی  مافل بوده و  وریدهای گردنی برجسته می باشد. صداهای تنفسی طبیعی هستند. ارزیابی بیشتر این بیمار به احتمال زیاد کدام یک از یافته‌های زیر را نشان خواهد داد؟
answer: A drop in systolic blood pressure of 14 mmHg during inspiration
answer_persian: کاهش فشار خون سیستولیک به میزان ۱۴ میلی‌متر جیوه در هنگام دم

options.A: Tracheal deviation toward the right side
options.C: A drop in systolic blood pressure of 14 mmHg during inspiration
options.D: Herniation of the stomach into the chest
options.E:
Paradoxical motion of part of the chest with breathing
"

options_persian.C: کاهش فشار خون سیستولیک به میزان ۱۴ میلی‌متر جیوه در هنگام دم
options_persian.D: فتق معده به داخل قفسه سینه
options_persian.E: حرکت پارادوکسیک قسمتی از قفسه سینه با تنفس

new_question_stem: A 24-year-old man is brought to the emergency department 15 minutes after he sustained a stab wound to the left chest just below the clavicle. On arrival, he has rapid, shallow breathing and appears anxious. His pulse rate is 135/min, respiratory rate is 30/min and shallow, and palpable systolic blood pressure is 80 mm Hg. He is intubated and mechanically ventilated. Infusion of 0.9% saline is begun. Five minutes later, his pulse rate is 133/min and blood pressure is 82/45 mm Hg. Examination shows no active external bleeding. There is a 2.5-cm single stab wound to the left chest at the 4th intercostal space at the midclavicular line. Cardiovascular examination shows muffled heart sounds and jugular venous distention. Breath sounds are normal. Further evaluation of this patient is most likely to show which of the following findings?

question: A 37-year-old man with no significant past medical history is rear-ended in a motor vehicle accident. He reported significant neck pain to emergency responders, but otherwise denies weakness, numbness or tingling in his extremities. His vitals on presentation to the ED are HR 90, BP 140/80, RR 20, SpO2 98%. What is the most appropriate next step upon presentation to the emergency room?
question_persian: مردی ۳۷ ساله بدون سابقه پزشکی قابل توجه در یک تصادف خودرو از پشت دچار حادثه شده است. او به امدادگران اورژانس درد شدید گردن را گزارش داد، اما ضعف، بی‌حسی یا سوزن‌سوزن شدن در اندام‌هایش را تکذیب کرد. علائم حیاتی او در هنگام مراجعه به بخش اورژانس به شرح زیر است: ضربان قلب ۹۰، فشار خون ۱۴۰/۸۰، تعداد تنفس ۲۰، اشباع اکسیژن ۹۸٪. مناسب‌ترین اقدام بعدی در هنگام مراجعه به اتاق اورژانس چیست؟

options_persian.B: سری سه نمای ستون فقرات گردنی
options_persian.E: تحت نظر قرار دادن در بخش  به مدت  یک شب

new_question_stem: A 37-year-old man with no significant past medical history is rear-ended in a motor vehicle accident. He reported significant neck pain to emergency responders, but otherwise denies weakness, numbness or tingling in his extremities. His vitals on presentation to the ED are HR 90, BP 140/80, RR 20, SpO2 98%. What is the most appropriate next step upon presentation to the emergency room?
additional_correct_answer:
Acetaminophen 1000mg
pain management is recommended in soft tissue injury.
additional_correct_answer_source: Kian Preston-Suni, Amy H. Kaji, Spinal Trauma, Ron M. Walls, Robert S. Hockberger, Marianne B. Erickson, editors. ROSEN'S Emergency Medicine, 10th edition, Philadelphia: Elsevier; 2022. p366

question: A 19-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by ambulance because of unusual behavior that started 3 hours ago while he was at a party. He has a history of major depressive disorder and seasonal allergies. His mother has a history of anxiety. He drinks 5 beers on the weekends. Current medications include amitriptyline and diphenhydramine. The patient does not respond to questions and repeatedly says, ""The government is following me everywhere."" His temperature is 37.9°C (100.2°F), pulse is 115/min, respirations are 24/min, and blood pressure is 160/89 mm Hg. He is diaphoretic. He is not oriented to place or time. Neurologic examination shows dilated pupils bilaterally and diffuse hyperreflexia. His feet are cold, and capillary refill time is 3 seconds. After the examination, the patient starts screaming and tries to bite the physician. Urine toxicology screening is positive for ethyl glucuronide. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for this patient's symptoms?"
question_persian: مردی ۱۹ ساله توسط آمبولانس به بخش اورژانس آورده شده است به دلیل رفتار غیرطبیعی  که ۳ ساعت پیش در حالی که در یک مهمانی بود شروع شد. او سابقه اختلال افسردگی ماژور و آلرژی‌های فصلی دارد. مادرش سابقه اضطراب دارد. او در آخر هفته‌ها   واحد ۵ آبجو می‌نوشد. داروهای فعلی شامل آمی‌تریپتیلین و دیفن‌هیدرامین هستند. بیمار به سوالات پاسخ نمی‌دهد و به طور مکرر می‌گوید، "دولت مرا همه جا تعقیب می‌کند." دمای بدن او ۳۷.۹ درجه سانتی‌گراد (۱۰۰.۲ درجه فارنهایت)، نبض ۱۱۵ در دقیقه، تنفس ۲۴ در دقیقه، و فشار خون ۱۶۰/۸۹ میلی‌متر جیوه است. او تعریق زیادی دارد. به زمان و مکان آگاه نیست. درمعاینه عصبی مردمک‌های دو طرف گشاد بوده و رفلکس  های تاندونی عمقی افزایش یافته است. پاهای او سرد است و زمان پر شدن مویرگی ۳ ثانیه است. پس از معاینه، بیمار شروع به فریاد زدن می‌کند و تلاش می‌کند پزشک را گاز بگیرد. آزمایش غربالگری سم‌شناسی ادرار برای اتیل گلوکورونید مثبت است. کدام یک از موارد زیر به احتمال زیاد توضیح‌دهنده علائم این بیمار است؟
new_question_stem: A 19-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by ambulance because of unusual behavior that started 3 hours ago while he was at a party. He has a history of major depressive disorder and seasonal allergies. His mother has a history of anxiety. He drinks 5 beers on the weekends. Current medications include amitriptyline and diphenhydramine. The patient does not respond to questions and repeatedly says, ""The government is following me everywhere."" His temperature is 37.9°C (100.2°F), pulse is 115/min, respirations are 24/min, and blood pressure is 160/89 mm Hg. He is diaphoretic. He is not oriented to place or time. Neurologic examination shows dilated pupils bilaterally and diffuse hyperreflexia. His feet are cold, and capillary refill time is 3 seconds. After the examination, the patient starts screaming and tries to bite the physician. Urine toxicology screening is positive for ethyl glucuronide. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for this patient's symptoms?"
additional_correct_answer_source: Utshma Khatri, David H. Jang, Hallucinogens, Tintinalli JE, Stapczynski JD, Ma OR, Cline DM, Riviello EA, editors. Tintinalli's Emergency Medicine 9th edition, New York, MCGraw-Hill-2021 p:1243,1244

question: A 25-year-old man presents to the emergency department with altered mental status. He was found down in the middle of the street. His past medical history is unknown. His temperature is 99.0°F (37.2°C), blood pressure is 104/64 mmHg, pulse is 70/min, respirations are 5/min, and oxygen saturation is 91% on room air. The patient is being resuscitated in the trauma bay. Which of the following was most likely to be found on exam?
question_persian: مردی ۲۵ ساله با کاهش سطح هوشیاری  به بخش اورژانس اورده شده است. او درحالی که وسط خیابان افتاده بوده، پیدا شده است. سابقه پزشکی او مشخص نیست. دمای بدن او ۹۹.۰ درجه فارنهایت (۳۷.۲ درجه سانتی‌گراد)، فشار خون او ۱۰۴/۶۴ میلی‌متر جیوه، ضربان قلب او ۷۰ در دقیقه، تعداد تنفس او ۵ در دقیقه و اشباع اکسیژن او ۹۱ درصد در هوای اتاق است. بیمار در بخش تروما احیا می‌شود. کدامیک از موارد زیر به احتمال زیاد در معاینه یافت می‌شود؟
new_question_stem: A 25-year-old man is brought to the emergency department with altered mental status. He was found down in the middle of the street. His past medical history is unknown. His temperature is 99.0°F (37.2°C), blood pressure is 104/64 mmHg, pulse rate is 70/min, respiratory rate is 5/min, and oxygen saturation is 91% on room air. The patient is being resuscitated in the trauma bay. Which of the following is most likely to be found on the physical examination?

question: A 23-year-old man is brought to the emergency department 25 minutes after being involved in a high-speed motor vehicle collision in which he was the restrained driver. On questioning by the paramedics, he reported severe chest pain and mild dyspnea. On arrival, he is confused and unable to provide a history. His pulse is 93/min, respirations are 28/min, and blood pressure is 91/65 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 88%. He is able to move his extremities in response to commands. He opens his eyes spontaneously. Pupils are equal and reactive to light. Examination shows multiple bruises over the trunk and extremities. There is a 3-cm (1.2-in) wound at the left fifth intercostal space at the midclavicular line. There is jugular venous distention. Decreased breath sounds and hyperresonance on percussion are noted on the left. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?
question_persian: مردی ۲۳ ساله ۲۵ دقیقه پس از سانحه تصادف خودرو با سرعت بالا  به اورژانس اورده می شود،  وی راننده‌ خودروبوده  و کمربند ایمنی را بسته بوده است. در صحنه و در پاسخ به سوالات  پرسنل اوژانس، او از درد شدید قفسه سینه و تنگی نفس خفیف شکایت داشته ، ولی در هنگام ورود، به اورژانس، گیج بوده و قادر به ارائه شرح حال نیست. نبض او ۹۳ در دقیقه، تنفس‌ها ۲۸ در دقیقه، و فشار خون ۶۵/۹۱ میلی‌متر جیوه است. پالس اکسیمتری در هوای اتاق اشباع اکسیژن ۸۸٪ را نشان می‌دهد. او  در پاسخ به دستورات اندام‌هایش را حرکت می دهد، به طور خودبخودی چشمانش را باز می‌کند. سایز مردمک‌های دوطرف برابر و  با پاسخ به نور می‌باشند. معاینه چندین کبودی بر روی تنه و اندام‌ها را نشان می‌دهد. یک زخم ۳ سانتی‌متری در فضای بین دنده‌ای پنجم در خط میانی ترقوه‌ای چپ وجود دارد. وریدهای گردنی متسع هستند. کاهش صداهای تنفسی و هایپررِزونانس در دق  سمت چپ  قفسه سینه مشاهده می‌شود. کدامیک از اقدامات زیر مناسب‌ترین گام بعدی در مدیریت است؟
new_question_stem: A 23-year-old man is brought to the emergency department 25 minutes after being involved in a high-speed motor vehicle collision in which he was the restrained driver. On questioning by the paramedics, he reported severe chest pain and mild dyspnea. On arrival, he is confused and unable to provide a history. His pulse rate is 93/min, respiratory rate is 28/min, and blood pressure is 91/65 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 88%. He is able to move his extremities in response to commands. He opens his eyes spontaneously. Pupils are equal and reactive to light. Examination shows multiple bruises over the trunk and extremities. There is a 3-cm (1.2-in) wound at the left fifth intercostal space at the midclavicular line. There is jugular venous distention. Decreased breath sounds and hyperresonance on percussion are noted on the left. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in his management?

question: A 76-year-old man is brought to the physician by his wife because of low back pain and weakness for the past 4 weeks. He says that the pain is sharp, radiates to his left side, and has a burning quality. He has had a cough occasionally productive of blood-streaked sputum for the past 2 months. He has had 3.2-kg (7.0-lb) weight loss in that time. He is now unable to walk without assistance and has had constipation and difficulty urinating for the past 2 weeks. He has hypertension treated with enalapril. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for 60 years. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 75/min, and blood pressure is 150/80 mm Hg. He is oriented to person, place, and time. Neurologic examination shows 3/5 strength of the lower extremities. Deep tendon reflexes are hyperreflexive. Babinski sign is present bilaterally. Sensory examination shows decreased sensation to pinprick below the T4 dermatome. He is unable to lie recumbent due to severe pain. An x-ray of the chest shows multiple round opacities of varying sizes in both lungs. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?
question_persian: یک مرد ۷۶ ساله توسط همسرش به پزشک آورده شده است به دلیل درد پایین کمر و ضعف در طی ۴ هفته گذشته. او یک درد تیز با ماهیت سوزشی و با  انتشار به سمت چپ را ذکر می کند.  او در طی ۲ ماه گذشته گاهی اوقات سرفه‌ای با خلط خونی داشته است. در این مدت ۳.۲ کیلوگرم (۷.۰ پوند) کاهش وزن داشته است. اکنون بدون کمک قادر به راه رفتن نیست و در طی ۲ هفته گذشته یبوست و مشکل در ادرار کردن داشته است. او فشار خون بالا دارد که با انالاپریل درمان می‌شود. او به مدت ۶۰ سال روزانه یک بسته سیگار کشیده است. دمای بدن او ۳۷ درجه سانتی‌گراد (۹۸.۶ درجه فارنهایت)، نبض ۷۵ در دقیقه، و فشار خون ۱۵۰/۸۰ میلی‌متر جیوه است. او به شخص، مکان و زمان آگاه است. معاینه عصبی نشان می‌دهد که قدرت اندام‌های تحتانی او ۳/۵ است. رفلکس‌های تاندونی عمقی افزایش یافته‌اند. علامت بابینسکی دو طرفه وجود دارد. معاینه حسی کاهش حس به سوزن زیر درماتوم L4 را نشان می‌دهد. او قادر به دراز کشیدن به حالت طاق‌باز به دلیل درد شدید نیست. عکس‌برداری با اشعه ایکس از قفسه سینه نشان می‌دهد که چندین کدورت گرد با اندازه‌های مختلف در هر دو ریه وجود دارد. کدام یک از مراحل زیر مناسب‌ترین اقدام بعدی در مدیریت این بیمار است؟

options_persian.D: درمان با سفتریاکسون و آزیترومایسین داخل وریدی

meta_info_TopicSystem: Musculoskeletal System & Skin, Infectious Diseases, Nervous System
new_question_stem: A 76-year-old man is brought to the physician by his wife because of low back pain and weakness for the past 4 weeks. He says that the pain is sharp, radiates to his left side, and has a burning quality. He has had a cough occasionally productive of blood-streaked sputum for the past 2 months. He has had 3.2-kg (7.0-lb) weight loss in that time. He is now unable to walk without assistance and has had constipation and difficulty urinating for the past 2 weeks. He has hypertension treated with enalapril. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for 60 years. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 75/min, and blood pressure is 150/80 mm Hg. He is oriented to person, place, and time. Neurologic examination shows 3/5 strength of the lower extremities. Deep tendon reflexes are hyperreflexive. Babinski sign is present bilaterally. Sensory examination shows decreased sensation to pinprick below the L4 dermatome. He is unable to lie recumbent due to severe pain. An x-ray of the chest shows multiple round opacities of varying sizes in both lungs. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

question: An 8-year-old girl presents to the emergency department with respiratory distress, facial edema, and a skin rash after eating a buffet dinner with her family. She was born at 39 weeks via spontaneous vaginal delivery, has met all developmental milestones and is fully vaccinated. Past medical history is significant for mild allergies to pet dander and ragweed, as well as a severe peanut allergy. She also has asthma. She normally carries both an emergency inhaler and EpiPen but forgot them today. Family history is noncontributory. The vital signs include: blood pressure 112/87 mm Hg, heart rate 111/min, respiratory rate 25/min, and temperature 37.2°C (99.0°F). On physical examination, the patient has severe edema over her face and an audible stridor in both lungs. Of the following options, which is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?
question_persian: دختری ۸ ساله به بخش اورژانس مراجعه کرده که دچار تنگی نفس، تورم صورت و ضایعات پوستی  بعد از مصرف شام بوفه‌ای با خانواده‌اش شده است. او در ۳۹ هفتگی با زایمان طبیعی به دنیا آمده است، تمامی مراحل رشد را طی کرده و به طور کامل واکسینه شده است. سابقه پزشکی او شامل آلرژی‌های خفیف به شوره حیوانات ، علف هرز و همچنین آلرژی شدید به بادام زمینی است. او همچنین آسم دارد. او معمولاً یک اسپری استنشاقی و یک قلم اپی‌پن حمل می‌کند اما امروز آنها را فراموش کرده است. سابقه خانوادگی او نرمال است. علائم حیاتی شامل: فشار خون ۱۱۲/۸۷ میلی‌متر جیوه، ضربان قلب ۱۱۱ در دقیقه، تعداد تنفس ۲۵ در دقیقه و دمای بدن ۳۷.۲ درجه سانتی‌گراد (۹۹.۰ درجه فارنهایت) است. در معاینه فیزیکی، بیمار تورم شدید در صورت و صدای واضح استریدور در هر دو ریه دارد. از گزینه‌های زیر، کدام یک مناسب‌ترین مرحله بعدی در مدیریت این بیمار است؟

options.E: inhaled sodium cromolyn - mast cell stabilizer

options_persian.D: دیفن‌هیدرامین موضعی با  ماده موثره مضاعف
options_persian.E: سل ها کرمولین سدیم استنشاقی - تثبیت‌کننده ماست

new_question_stem: An 8-year-old girl presents to the emergency department with respiratory distress, facial edema, and a skin rash after eating a buffet dinner with her family. She was born at 39 weeks via spontaneous vaginal delivery, has met all developmental milestones and is fully vaccinated. Past medical history is significant for mild allergies to pet dander and ragweed, as well as a severe peanut allergy. She also has asthma. She normally carries both an emergency inhaler and EpiPen but forgot them today. Family history is noncontributory. The vital signs include: blood pressure 112/87 mm Hg, heart rate 111/min, respiratory rate 25/min, and temperature 37.2°C (99.0°F). On physical examination, the patient has severe edema over her face and an audible stridor in both lungs. Of the following options, which is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

question: A 25-year-old man with a past medical history of constipation and fibromyalgia presents to the emergency department with generalized malaise and severe diarrhea. The patient states that he has not felt well for the past 24 hours and his symptoms are no longer tolerable. He denies taking any medications or illicit drugs and states he is generally healthy. His temperature is 99.3°F (37.4°C), blood pressure is 122/88 mmHg, pulse is 107/min, respirations are 19/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. Physical exam demonstrates an ill appearing young man. Physical exam is notable for rhinorrhea, lacrimation, and piloerection. The patient’s pupils are dilated and reactive to light. During placement of an ultrasound guided IV, multiple scars are noted in the antecubital fossa, and it is noted that it is very difficult to place an IV in this patient. During the exam, he begins actively vomiting. Which of the following could be an appropriate treatment for this patient’s symptoms?
question_persian: مردی ۲۵ ساله با سابقه‌ی پزشکی یبوست و فیبرومیالژیا به بخش اورژانس مراجعه می‌کند با حالت عمومی ناخوشی و اسهال شدید. بیمار اظهار می‌کند که در ۲۴ ساعت گذشته حال خوبی نداشته و علائم او دیگر قابل تحمل نیستند. او استفاده از هر دارو یا مواد مخدر غیرقانونی را رد می‌کند و بیان می‌کند که سالم می باشد. دمای بدن او ۹۹.۳ درجه فارنهایت (۳۷.۴ درجه سانتیگراد)، فشار خون ۱۲۲/۸۸ میلی‌متر جیوه، نبض ۱۰۷ ضربه در دقیقه، تعداد تنفس ۱۹ بار در دقیقه و اشباع اکسیژن ۹۹٪ در هوای اتاق است. در معاینه فیزیکی  ill به نظر می‌رسد. در معاینه فیزیکی، رینوره، اشک‌ریزی و سیخ شدن  موهای بدن قابل‌توجه است. مردمک‌های بیمار گشاد بوده  و به نور واکنش نشان می‌دهند. در هنگام تعبیه راه وریدی ،وی (IV) با هدایت اولتراسوند، چندین زخم در ناحیه حفره آرنج مشاهده می‌شود و مشخص می‌شود که قرار دادن آی‌وی در این بیمار بسیار دشوار است. در هنگام معاینه، بیمار شروع به استفراغ فعال می‌کند. کدام یک از موارد زیر می‌تواند درمان مناسبی برای علائم این بیمار باشد؟
new_question_stem: A 25-year-old man with a past medical history of constipation and fibromyalgia presents to the emergency department with generalized malaise and severe diarrhea. The patient states that he has not felt well for the past 24 hours and his symptoms are no longer tolerable. He denies taking any medications or illicit drugs and states he is generally healthy. His temperature is 99.3°F (37.4°C), blood pressure is 122/88 mmHg, pulse rate is 107/min, respiratory rate is 19/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. Physical exam demonstrates an ill appearing young man. Physical exam is notable for rhinorrhea, lacrimation, and piloerection. The patient’s pupils are dilated and reactive to light. During placement of an ultrasound guided IV, multiple scars are noted in the antecubital fossa, and it is noted that it is very difficult to place an IV in this patient. During the exam, he begins actively vomiting. Which of the following could be an appropriate treatment for this patient’s symptoms?
additional_correct_answer:
Methadone
replacement therapy is considered for moderately severe symptoms.
additional_correct_answer_source: Jennifer S. Love. Opioids,  Tintinalli JE, Stapczynski JD, Ma OR, Cline DM, Riviello EA, editors. Tintinalli's Emergency Medicine 9th edition, New York, MCGraw-Hill-2021, p1238

question: A 55-year-old woman with a history of HIV presents to the emergency department with progressive dyspnea, fever, and dry cough for the past 4 days. She has not been compliant with antiretroviral or prophylactic medication. On evaluation, the patient is in moderate respiratory distress. The temperature is 38.8°C (102.0°F), the blood pressure is 124/82 mm Hg, the pulse is 96/min, and the respiratory rate is 20/min. Pulse oximetry is 92% on 4 L oxygen by nasal cannula. Her CD4 count is 180 cells/μL. IV antibiotics and glucocorticoids are administered. After 30 minutes, the patient develops severe respiratory distress. Repeat vital signs show: temperature 38.3°C (101.0°F), blood pressure 80/50 mm Hg, pulse 104/min, respiration rate 32/min and pulse oximetry 85% on nasal cannula. The trachea deviates to the left. Breath sounds are absent on the right side and the neck veins are distended. Telemetry shows sinus tachycardia. Which of the following is the best next step in the management of this patient?
question_persian: یک زن ۵۵ ساله با سابقه ابتلا به HIV به بخش اورژانس مراجعه کرده است که به مدت چهار روز دچار تنگی نفس پیش‌رونده، تب و سرفه خشک بوده است. او در استفاده از داروهای ضد ویروسی یا داروهای پیشگیری‌کننده پایبند نبوده است. در ارزیابی، بیمار دچار دیسترس تنفسی متوسط است. دمای بدن او ۳۸.۸ درجه سانتی‌گراد (۱۰۲.۰ درجه فارنهایت)، فشار خون ۱۲۴/۸۲ میلی‌متر جیوه، نبض ۹۶ ضربه در دقیقه و تعداد تنفس ۲۰ تا در دقیقه است. پالس اکسیمتری ۹۲٪ روی ۴ لیتر اکسیژن با کانولای بینی نشان می‌دهد. تعداد CD4 او ۱۸۰ سلول در میکرولیتر است. آنتی‌بیوتیک‌های وریدی و گلوکوکورتیکوئیدها تجویز می‌شوند. پس از ۳۰ دقیقه، بیمار دچار ناراحتی تنفسی شدید می‌شود. علائم حیاتی مجدد نشان می‌دهند: دمای بدن ۳۸.۳ درجه سانتی‌گراد (۱۰۱.۰ درجه فارنهایت)، فشار خون ۸۰/۵۰ میلی‌متر جیوه، نبض ۱۰۴ ضربه در دقیقه، تعداد تنفس ۳۲ تا در دقیقه و پالس اکسیمتری ۸۵٪ با دریافت اکسیژن از طریق کانولای بینی.  انحراف نای به سمت چپ مشاهده می‌شود. صدای تنفس در سمت راست وجود ندارد و رگ‌های گردن برجسته هستند. معاینه تاکیکاردی سینوسی را نشان می‌دهد. بهترین قدم بعدی در مدیریت این بیمار کدام است؟
new_question_stem: A 55-year-old woman with a history of HIV presents to the emergency department with progressive dyspnea, fever, and dry cough for the past 4 days. She has not been compliant with antiretroviral or prophylactic medication. On evaluation, the patient is in moderate respiratory distress. The temperature is 38.8°C (102.0°F), the blood pressure is 124/82 mm Hg, the pulse rate is 96/min, and the respiratory rate is 20/min. Pulse oximetry is 92% on 4 L oxygen by nasal cannula. Her CD4 count is 180 cells/μL. IV antibiotics and glucocorticoids are administered. After 30 minutes, the patient develops severe respiratory distress. Repeat vital signs show: temperature 38.3°C (101.0°F), blood pressure 80/50 mm Hg, pulse rate 104/min, respiratory rate 32/min and pulse oximetry 85% on nasal cannula. The trachea deviates to the left. Breath sounds are absent on the right side and the neck veins are distended. Telemetry shows sinus tachycardia. Which of the following is the best next step in the management of this patient?

question:
A 24-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by the police. He was found unconscious and covered in bruises outside of a local bar. The patient has a past medical history of polysubstance abuse, depression, multiple suicide attempts, neuropathic pain, and schizophrenia. As part of the patient’s initial workup, a head CT is performed which is unremarkable, and an arterial blood gas is performed as seen below:

pH: 7.29
PaCO2: 95 mm Hg
PaO2: 70 mm Hg
Bicarbonate: 24 mEq/L

Which of the following is the most likely etiology of this patient’s current presentation?
question_persian: مردی 24 ساله توسط پلیس به بخش اورژانس آورده شده است. او در حالت  بیهوشی و با کبودی های متعدد، خارج از یک بار محلی پیدا شد. بیمار دارای سابقه پزشکی سوء مصرف چند ماده، افسردگی، چندین تلاش برای خودکشی، درد نوروپاتیک و اسکیزوفرنی است، در بررسی های اولیه بیمار، سی‌تی اسکن سر انجام شد که طبیعی بود و آزمایش گاز خون شریانی به شرح زیر انجام شد:پ‌اچ: 7.29پ‌آ‌CO2: 95 میلی‌متر جیوهپ‌آ‌O2: 70 میلی‌متر جیوهبی‌کربنات: 24 میلی‌اکی‌والان در لیترکدام یک از موارد زیر محتمل‌ترین علت وضعیت فعلی بیمار است؟
new_question_stem:
A 24-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by the police. He was found unconscious and covered in bruises outside of a local bar. The patient has a past medical history of polysubstance abuse, depression, multiple suicide attempts, neuropathic pain, and schizophrenia. As part of the patient’s initial workup, a head CT is performed which is unremarkable, and an arterial blood gas is performed as seen below:

pH: 7.29
PaCO2: 95 mm Hg
PaO2: 70 mm Hg
Bicarbonate: 24 mEq/L

Which of the following is the most likely etiology of this patient’s current presentation?
